p: 5-HT1A receptors control the antinausea effects of CBDA. In vivo mice study showed that CBDA inhibited vomiting caused by toxins and induced 5-HT1A receptor activity [ 70, 71]. The pharmacokinetics of phytocannabinoid acids (including CBDA with others) showed that plasma level absorption occurred rapidly, and the brain/plasma ratio was very low. However, when CBDA was administered in an alternate Tween 80-based vehicle, the value of the brain/plasma ratio was 1.9 and in Scn1a RX/+ mouse model of Dravet syndrome, and CBDA showed potent anticonvulsant activity [ 72].
